H0.text: A stream is a body of freshwater that flows downhill in a channel.

H1.text: A river is a body of freshwater that flows downhill in a channel.

H2.text: An eddy is a body of freshwater that flows downhill in a channel.

H3.text: A creek is a body of freshwater that flows downhill in a channel.

A4.text: A river is a natural stream of fresh water that flows on land or inside caves towards another body of water at a lower elevation, such as an ocean, lake, or another river.

A5.text: Rivers flow in channeled watercourses and merge in confluences to form drainage basins, areas where surface water eventually flows to a common outlet.
